title: Environmental Protection vs. Economic Development
description: As the mayor of a small economically depressed town, you must decide whether to approve a new mining operation. The mine would create 500 well-paying jobs in a community with 15% unemployment and revitalize the local economy. However, environmental assessments indicate it would likely cause significant damage to a nearby river ecosystem that contains several endangered species and provides clean water to downstream communities. The mining company has proposed some mitigation measures but acknowledges they cannot eliminate all environmental risks. Local opinion is sharply divided between those who prioritize economic opportunity and those who value environmental protection.

contextual_factors.explanation: The decision maker is an elected official with responsibilities to both present constituents and future generations.
Different stakeholder groups have directly competing interests and values.
Environmental impacts can be estimated but not predicted with absolute certainty.
Economic prosperity and environmental preservation represent different types of value that cannot be directly compared.
The town has experienced sustained economic decline for decades, affecting community identity and well-being.
Legal frameworks provide both environmental protection requirements and economic development mandates.
Few other economic development options are currently available to the community.
There are significant power imbalances between stakeholders, with future generations having no direct voice.

possible_actions.name: Approve Mining Operation
possible_actions.description: Grant full approval for the mining operation with standard environmental requirements

outcomes.economic: Significant economic boost with ~500 direct jobs and 1000+ indirect jobs
outcomes.environmental: Substantial environmental damage with partial mitigation efforts
outcomes.social: Community division with economic benefits for some and environmental costs for all

possible_actions.name: Approve with Enhanced Conditions
possible_actions.description: Approve mining with significantly enhanced environmental protections and monitoring

outcomes.economic: Moderate economic boost with ~350 direct jobs and 700+ indirect jobs
outcomes.environmental: Moderate environmental damage with substantial mitigation efforts
outcomes.social: Partial community satisfaction with compromise between values

possible_actions.name: Reject Mining Operation
possible_actions.description: Reject the mining proposal entirely to protect the ecosystem

outcomes.economic: Continued economic stagnation with potential for alternative development approaches
outcomes.environmental: Full environmental protection of current ecosystem
outcomes.social: Community division with environmental victory but continued economic hardship

possible_actions.name: Delay for Alternative Assessment
possible_actions.description: Delay decision to commission study on alternative economic development options

outcomes.economic: Short-term economic stagnation with uncertain long-term prospects
outcomes.environmental: Temporary environmental protection with uncertain future
outcomes.social: Temporary reduction in community tension with continued uncertainty
